review_title: Is A Good Place For Employment
pros: I like the work and the bosses seem to care
cons: We are paid minimum wage when we do the amount of work done for 3 jobs.

review_title: Do it for the right reasons
pros: A great place to serve God’s kingdom by empowering the next generation. Service Culture Impact PTO Benefits
cons: Pay benefits PTO Changes Lack of promotion

review_title: Loved Being Apart of the Jessup Family!
pros: At Jessup, you will be known by name, not an employee ID number. You will be valued and appreciated on a daily basis. People will love you and care for you, unlike any other company! You will not regret working here!
cons: Unfortunately, the pay is on the lower end of the spectrum.
Not much room for advancement if that's what you're into.

pros: WJU is a wonderful place to work. If you are looking for a work environment that makes you feel valued and appreciated then Jessup is a place that you should consider. Great people, great team, great school!
cons: Because Jessup is a smaller school you can expect your salary to be below the average rate for Admissions Counseling. Jessup is a non-profit, private, Christ-centered University so they don't have as much bandwidth for compensation. I wish that wasn't the case but sacrificing the salary for a workplace that truly knows and appreciates you are worth it.

review_title: Good environment but not good pay
job_title: Information Technology Technician Tier-1 in Rocklin, CA
pros: The people are super friendly and nice for the most part. My team was pretty fun. And my boss wanted us to succeed and to learn as much as we can while we're there.
cons: My position was unnecessarily too stressful for what it was. People really demand a lot from the IT support without enough acknowledgment of the hard work we put in. The hierarchy in the office felt unfair. The raises weren't based on merit, they were based on seniority and if they got more funding to their department budget. The pay was not comparable for the work and having a college degree. I know that's across the board the story at this university. The covid restrictions weren't enough to keep us safe either.

pros: Friendly Environment! I love to be there!
cons: There are no cons about this place

review_title: Fun job, no pay, no future
job_title: Campus Safety Officer in Rocklin, CA
pros: The staff and faculty provide great community. It's an excellent way to serve students.
cons:
No differential pay, low pay, no matching retirement, minimal cost of living increases.

Director had no experience and seemed to work part time.

job_title: Assistant Women's Volleyball Coach in Rocklin, CA
pros: Great place to work and a tight knit community! Everyone is so welcoming and friendly and I have a voice and my opinion or points are always respected.
cons: If you are not a fan of a small campus or workplace, this is not the place for you.

review_title: Students are so respectful, spoiled with entitlement attitudes
pros: Absolutely none at all. I have taught at the college and university level for over 20 years. Hands down, this was truly my worst experience.
cons:
Low pay for instructors.  My semester contract pay was the same as when I started teaching at the local community college 20 years ago!   Students continuously talking during lectures--on a $30k education???  Spoiled, insolent, acts like the world and faculty are there to serve them ( probably bc they get the best facilities and amenities---often on taxpayer funded student loans).  I had to deal w sour looks and immature students who acted like they were challenging me to impress them. My students at the local community colleges--same semester were more respectful and appreciative of their education than the spoiled children at wsj. Other adjunct faculty I have spoken to report the same experience. 
I agree w previous reviewer who states that administration reflects a good old boys attitude. When I was at WSJ there was only one newly appointed woman in administration. 
During weekly chapel, students would spend service with their arms folded, checking their iPhones.  No presence of the Holy Spirit. WSJ is Christian in name only.

review_title: Good professional growth, friendly people, but bad executive management
job_title: Assistant In Administrative Office in Rocklin, CA
pros: There are some really solid, caring, and committed people working at this school. Almost everyone that works there stays because they are passionate about students growth as Christians and as human beings. I enjoyed my time as a student and an employee, most of the time.
cons: Pay isn't all that great. There is a high turn-over rate of employees - it seems like someone is always leaving. The atmosphere feels like a good ol' boys club and there are mainly men in charge and in management positions. There is a sense of hiding important facts from employees and students. The school works people very hard.

review_title: New administration is horrible. Changing original values and mission of school to a fake and abusive environment
pros: Working with students is awesome. The growth there has been based on student relationships with faculty from previous years.
cons: Truth is sad: The new president & provost are terrible leaders. Ruining the solid reputation of the school. Nepotism, anger reactions, intentional firings of people trying to give constructive feedback, are leading the highest quality profs and staff to find other work, retire earlier than planned, or keep their head down and not speak up. I am one of these people. I'd estimate about a 50-60% turnover rate since new leadership took over. Also, the workload is immense because of expansion of degree offerings without expansion of faculty and infrastructure.

pros: Opens door to faculty starting out. Helped me build my resume for my current academic work.
cons: Sad discovery led to my turning down a full-time faculty position in the psychology department. I learned the previous department leadership had to leave due to the new chair's unscrupulous and harsh behavior toward them that went unaddressed by leadership. This person sought employment in the department while he had clinical relationships and obligations with several of the faculty in the department. Four of them had to leave due to the resulting unsafe work environment and his unwillingness to correct the situation. I learned he has a personal relationship with the president that kept him from being fired. He severely damaged these people, caused them to have to leave, and resulted in my refusal to work with him in the department.

pros: Great community of staff and faculty. Nice location and campus. Flexible hours and some great supervisors. They give students and alumni good opportunities to come work and be trained.
cons: Entitled students. Poor management and leadership. The current president has no idea how to run the school. Unethical practices happening behind the scenes. Lay offs, pay cuts, and furlough days because of poor leadership decisions and lack of planning.

pros: Teamwork, friendly community, great small perks like free lunches & coffee
cons: Messy systems between departments, silos, budget restrictions

pros: Definitely understands the power of community and team building. If your passion is higher education, it's an ideal place to work.
cons: Salary is below industry standards but this is a constant issue in all Christian higher education institutions.

pros: Positive environment, wonderful cafeteria, great people
cons: Low pay, little room for growth

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Baltimore, MD
cons: Very impressive track record and I am happy for the way you treated some patient in the past and present.

pros:
Team atmosphere
Great classes
Great students
Student centered
cons:
Smaller than other universities
Traffic up 80 & 65
